Issues.Title: DatePicker in DataGrid loses data
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.5
* Windows version: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No.

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
DataGrid has DatePicker embedded. Enter a date in the Date column (DatePicker). Tab to the next column. Enter data. Then observe that the Date column goes blank, losing the date. The date should stay.
 
 **Actual behavior:**
Date column goes blank.
 
 **Expected behavior:**
Date column should retain the entered date. 

 **Minimal repro:**
Steps to the problem.

[iacc_core.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/5013526/iacc_core.zip)
Setup:

Unzip iacc_core.zip into a directory of your choosing.

Subdirectory acc_db contains MySQL schema and data. Hopefully, you can do a data import in MySQL Workbench to load test scheme with test data. 

You will need to adjust directory paths and set up database connections.

Steps:

1. Compile and Run (i.e. Press F5 in Visual Studio).
Observe: The program opens. Focus is on the last row of the top DataGrid (Transactions).

2. Tab twice, then enter date "7/20/2020".
Observe date "7/20/2020" showing in DataPicker.

3. Tab once to "Ref" column. Type "2".
Observe the problem: DatePicker date disappears. The date should stay.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "DatePicker in DataGrid loses data" (#3299)

Issues.Title: Update to net5.0 template with backcompact
Issues.Body:
Works for

```
 dotnet new wpf -n wpf1 -f netcoreapp3.1
 dotnet new wpf -n wpf2
 dotnet new wpf -n wpf3 -f netcoreapp3.1 --target-framework-override net461
 dotnet new wpf -n wpf3 -f net5.0 --target-framework-override net6.0
 dotnet new wpf -n wpf4 -f net5.0 --target-framework-override net6.0
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Update to net5.0 template with backcompact" (#3302)

Issues.Title: Wrong behaviour of DataGridCellInfo Equality operator.
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`) - **Any**
* Windows version: (`winver`) - **Win7**
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes/No - **Yes**
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? If yes, please file the issue via the instructions [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/ide/how-to-report-a-problem-with-visual-studio?view=vs-2019). - **No**
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs). - **Not Related**

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
DataGridCellInfo equality operator returns wrong result when virtualization enabled.
 
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
Equality operator returns _false_ instead _true_ on the same cell. Disabling _RowVirtualization_ eliminate this issue.
 
 **Expected behavior:**
Obvious...
 
 **Minimal repro:**
_DataGrid_ with _RowVirtualization_ enabled and enough items in source collection to run in virtualization. Create _DataGridCellInfo_ object for any cell, keep it, then scroll to hide that cell (virtualize). Then create another _CellInfo_ for any visible cell. Then scroll back to first cell, create _CellInfo_ again and make "=="-ing.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Wrong behaviour of DataGridCellInfo Equality operator." (#3297)

Issues.Title: Expose more AutomationProperties
Issues.Body:
The currently available AutomationProperties require lots of work to fully control the UI Automation/Accessibility Tree and produce the best possible experience for ALL people using our software.

As an example, if I have a TextBlock containing a symbol (via an appropriate font) that is purely visual and next to another TextBlock that contains displayed text relating to the symbol, there is no easy way to hide the symbol TextBlock from the UIA tree.
The only way to do this seems to be to derive from the TextBlock and access the automation per directly to set `IsControl` and `IsContent` accordingly. That seems complex and unnecessary just to hide a symbol from the UIA Tree.

In UWP there is the [AccessibilityView](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.ui.xaml.automation.peers.accessibilityview) property that makes it easy to set this from XAML.
That would be a start.
Even better would be exposing AutomationProperties for all the [AutomationElementIdentifiers](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.automation.automationelementidentifiers?view=netcore-3.1).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Expose more AutomationProperties" (#3296)

Issues.Title: .NET Core 3.1 WPF Project build fails when project has a long path
Issues.Body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/1117902/net-core-31-wpf-project-build-fails-when-project-h.html)._ --- VS 2019 Pro Core 3.1 WPF When building a WPF that is within a deep path, the build fails with the following: >C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.1.301\Sdks\Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop\targets\Microsoft.WinFX.targets(225,9): error MC1000: Unknown build error, 'Could not find a part of the path 'C:\\obj\Debug\netcoreapp3.1\_MarkupCompile.cache'.' My project root folder path is 142 chars. My project name is 39 chars. The resuling intermediate MarkupCompile.cache path is 267 chars. If I change the path of the project, the compile succeeds. The project builds successfully directly from msbuild. Thank you. --- ### Original Comments #### Feedback Bot on 7/19/2020, 07:03 PM:

We have directed your feedback to the appropriate engineering team for further evaluation. The team will review the feedback and notify you about the next steps.

--- ### Original Solutions (no solutions)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ".NET Core 3.1 WPF Project build fails when project has a long path" (#3293)

Issues.Title: Unknown build error, 'An item with the same key has already been added.
Issues.Body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/853708/unknown-build-error-an-item-with-the-same-key-has.html)._ --- Working on WPF .NET Core 3.1 application and getting this error on first compile after edditing source code, no error if I rebuild it for the second time. VS 16.4.0 Pro. Error RG1000 Unknown build error, 'An item with the same key has already been added.' Vtsr C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.1.100\Sdks\Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop\targets\Microsoft.WinFX.targets 672 --- ### Original Comments #### Feedback Bot on 12/11/2019, 11:27 PM:

We have directed your feedback to the appropriate engineering team for further evaluation. The team will review the feedback and notify you about the next steps.

#### Feedback Bot on 1/16/2020, 05:46 PM: I have detected that for the last 35 days, this issue didn't have much product team activity and a very small amount of new votes or comments. Based on this, its severity, and affected area, it’s my experience that this issue is very unlikely to be fixed. #### Peter Czurak on 1/16/2020, 06:13 PM:

Yeah, more bugs in the product. Just amazing!

A bug is not a bug if Visual Studio Team has to fix it.

#### Karlsson, Henrik on 6/17/2020, 10:48 AM:

It would be amazing if this error could give more information. I'm currently running in to the same problem (.net core 3.1 on visual studio 16.7.0 Preview 2.0 and I just can't figure out what it is.. I've more or less stripped my project down to the bones. Maybe the "item" could be named in that error?

C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.1.400-preview-015151\Sdks\Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop\targets\Microsoft.WinFX.targets(672,5): error RG1000: Unknown build error, 'An item with the same key has already been added.'

#### Fabian Toader [MSFT] on 6/24/2020, 10:42 AM:

Can you please attach a simple repro project? Thanks!

#### Karlsson, Henrik on 6/25/2020, 02:26 PM:

ok, I figured out why this was happening in our projects.

It seems like .net core does not like xaml files with the same names inside the same csproj. I had to rename a bunch of xaml files to give them all unique names within the same csproj.

That's where I noticed that we had multiple Generic.xaml in the same csproj and the Themes one referenced the other.. somehow both got picked up independently so the referenced one was added twice and that way caused "same key" problem.

I renamed one of the Generic.xaml to some other name and referenced that instead and problem went away.

I don't know if this is the same problem @Peter Czurak had but it is not totally unlikely :-)

(The problem for generic.xaml actually goes away on second compile (somehow ends up hidden) but caused infinite loops during runtime load in some cases)

#### Karlsson, Henrik on 6/26/2020, 11:43 AM:

ok, I have even more info. We don't have our csproj files in the same path as the source code (the xaml and cs files) and it seems like if that is the case the intermediate files are just flattened in to one folder... causing problems when two files have the same name.

so example:

c:\dev\myproj\myproj.csproj

have links to

c:\dev\mysource\a.xaml

c:\dev\ mysource\folder\a.xaml

Both these files write intermediate files to the same folder and overwrite each other

It feels like maybe in these cases the path to the intermediate file should be based on the <link> metadata in the csproj file?

--- ### Original Solutions (no solutions)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unknown build error, 'An item with the same key has already been added." (#3292)

Issues.Title: Check mark of checked MenuItem on ToolBar is not visible
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1.302
* Windows version: 19041.388
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? If yes, please file the issue via the instructions [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/ide/how-to-report-a-problem-with-visual-studio?view=vs-2019). : No
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
Checkbox bakcground color of Checked MenuItem  placed on ToolBar is black.

Aero2 Theme (Windows10 Default Theme / PresentationFramework.Aero2)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57256282/88674046-48491b80-d124-11ea-989c-d08a6b53d787.png)

Aero Theme (PresentationFramework.Aero)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57256282/88686578-31a9c100-d132-11ea-8489-7619a7104504.png)

 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
Checkbox is filled with black and the check mark is not visible

 **Expected behavior:**
Specify an appropriate color to `ToolBarMenuCheckFill`.

https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/8920b2d117e115edbb793fbe8bde28c8a36e3b2d/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/Themes/XAML/ToolBar.xaml#L280

 **Minimal repro:**
```xaml
<ToolBarTray>
    <ToolBar>
        <Menu>
            <MenuItem Header="Menu">
                <MenuItem Header="CheckedMenuItem" IsCheckable="True" IsChecked="True"/>
            </MenuItem>
        </Menu>
    </ToolBar>
</ToolBarTray>
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Check mark of checked MenuItem on ToolBar is not visible" (#3287)

Issues.Title: WPF Conversion issue to .NET Core 3.1
Issues.Body:
We are converting a large commercial WPF application over to .NET Core 3.1 and have run into a problem that I'm not sure how to resolve.   

```error CS0433: The type 'ListBoxChrome' exists in both 'PresentationFramework.Aero, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35' and 'PresentationFramework.Aero2, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35'```

 This error happens in .NET Core because by default it pulls in ALL of the WPF assembles as references.  Unfortunately, both PresentationFramework.Aero and PresentationFramework.Aero2 assemblies define the **same class** under the **same namespace**.

Our xaml namespace looks like this:

```xmlns:mwt="clr-namespace:Microsoft.Windows.Themes;assembly=PresentationFramework.Aero"```

I'm assuming the issue is that the C# generated by the "code-behind" process for our xaml, has no way of distinguishing which assembly this comes from as both assemblies use the same namespace.

In .NET Framework, this was never an issue because you had control over which assemblies were referenced by your projects.

How does one workaround this?  

Thanks much,
James
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "WPF Conversion issue to .NET Core 3.1" (#3280)

Issues.Title: The TreeViewItem cannot stretch correctly
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: all 
* Windows version: all
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No.

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
 Usually we can reset the style of the ItemContainer for some controls to reset some properties like HorizontalAlignment, but for TreeView, we can not stretch the TreeViewItem by setting the TreeViewItemContainer. We can find quite a few posts regarding this issue, eg:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47258955/how-to-stretch-treeviewitem-width-to-fill-parent
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16374182/background-in-treeviewitem-not-full-width
https://leecampbell.com/2009/01/14/horizontal-stretch-on-treeviewitems/

The reason has been described in the above post. Because the ControlTemplate of the TreeViewItem has a grid with a 3×2 Grid. 
 The below content is copied from the [post](https://leecampbell.com/2009/01/14/horizontal-stretch-on-treeviewitems/)
> Things to note here is that the layout is controlled with a 3×2 Grid. Now notice that the Border that encapsulates the ContentPresenter (the place holder for where your values will live) is set to live in column 1 (remember 0 based index rules apply here). Also notice that the ItemsPresenter (the place holder for all the children of a TreeViewItem) is set to row 1 and column 1 & 2 (Grid.Column=”1″ Grid.ColumnSpan=”2″). Ok, so now that we know that we look back up to the Grid and notice that the column definitions are such that Column 1 has Width=”Auto” and Column 2 has Width=”*”. This effectively says column 1 can never effectively stretch.
 
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 Even we reset the style of TreeViewItemContainer to make the `HorizontalAlignment` property as `Stretch`, it will not work because the width of third column is `*`.

 **Expected behavior:**
 The TreeView control should allow users to reset the ItemContainer style to stretch the item.

The reason I raise this issue is for some reason, I need to attach events to the TreeViewItem, eg. tapped, it only works when we click the TextBlock or Image controls in the TreeViewItem. The empty space in the TreeViewItem is not clickable. So we have to find a easy way to make the container to stretch but for this scenario, changing the style of the TreeViewItemContainer will not work.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3395915/88456531-864f0100-ced2-11ea-8b8e-4b5be3aab28f.png)


I think the easiest way is to re-design the layout of the ControlTemplate of the TreeView to allow users stretch the item content. eg. remove the third column and set the column width of column 2 as `*`. Not sure if we have better solutions. Thanks.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The TreeViewItem cannot stretch correctly" (#3282)

Issues.Title: Use faster char based overload of String.IndexOf
Issues.Body:
- In dotnet/runtime#13339 I found that due to our changes to use icu by default there was a significant regression in Baml parsing time in .NET 5.0
- There is a plan to address most, if not all of that regression, but it won't be as good as simply using the char based IndexOf
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Use faster char based overload of String.IndexOf" (#3278)
